definition: to take off (one's clothes)/(fig.) to shed (one's former image etc)/(of a fad or the after-effects of a disaster etc) to subside/also pr. [tun4 qu4]
to slip out of sth/to hide sth in one's sleeve
to take off (clothes)/to shed feathers/(of color) to fade/to discolor

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: In April 1709 winter began to loosen its grip on the Ukraine.
sentences.chinese: 1709年4月，乌克兰的冬天开始渐渐褪去。

sentences.english: Because he got rid of his ignorant and uncouth sweetness, he is no longer a boy.
sentences.chinese: 因为褪去了年少无知和天真烂漫，他就不再是孩子了。

sentences.english: The faded favourites have let their new manager down.
sentences.chinese: 褪去的光环让他们的新教练十分沮丧。

sentences.english: Eye in of kill an idea to by far disappear.
Pinnochio finally sheds his wooden body and gets a real one.
sentences.chinese: 皮诺曹最后褪去了他的木头身体，成了真正的小孩。

sentences.english: One is a thick, shaggy coat that protects them in winter and falls away as seasons change and temperatures rise.
sentences.chinese: 当季节变化气温升高时，厚厚的毛就会逐渐褪去。

sentences.english: But the image of the skilled Italian worker lovingly plying his trade is fading fast.
sentences.chinese: 但是熟练意大利工人快乐工作的景象很快褪去。

sentences.english: China clothes fades to go, is a heart of plentiful Ying emotion.
sentences.chinese: 华裳褪去，是一颗丰盈感性的心。

sentences.english: Love you as you fade all pride.
sentences.chinese: 喜欢你才为你褪去所有的傲气。

sentences.english: But by 1980 the memory of the Depression had faded.
sentences.chinese: 可是到了1980年，大萧条时期的记忆已经褪去。

sentences.english: Sunlight won 't betray my lemon juice.
sentences.chinese: 阳光也不会褪去我的柠檬色的汁液。

sentences.english: As that started to ebb, I slowed.
sentences.chinese: 直到愤怒开始褪去，我才放慢了脚步。

sentences.english: In late September, the green cover is fading on Uzemchin grassland.
sentences.chinese: 9月下旬，乌珠穆沁草原已经褪去了绿色。

sentences.english: Fade in one of the "pickled uniform", the women began to dress himself heartily.
sentences.chinese: 褪去了一身的“臃装”，女人们开始尽情地打扮自己。

sentences.english: When I was fourteen years old, I lost my Russian accent.
sentences.chinese: 十四岁那年，我褪去了俄罗斯口音。

sentences.english: Eventually their skin lost its green color.
sentences.chinese: 后来，他们的皮肤褪去了绿色。

definition: to appear/to come out in the open
to slip out of sth/to hide sth in one's sleeve
to take off (clothes)/to shed feathers/(of color) to fade/to discolor
to obliterate completely/to vanish from the face of the earth
to substitute for sb/to remove and replace
